items.title: Categories

items.description: Get the web's modern capabilities on your own sites and apps with useful guidance and analysis from web.dev.
items.title: Web.dev

items.description: Uses PhantomJS to headlessly analyze web pages and generate manifests.
items.title: Confess

items.description: DebugBear is a site monitoring tool based on Lighthouse. See how your scores and metrics changed over time, with a focus on understanding what caused each change. DebugBear is a paid product with a free 30-day trial.
items.title: DebugBear

items.description: The PageSpeed family of tools is designed to help you optimize the performance of your site. PageSpeed Insights products will help you identify performance best practices that can be applied to your site, and PageSpeed optimization tools can help you automate the process.
items.title: Page Speed

items.description: Auditing and performance metrics tool for Progressive Web Applications.
items.title: Lighthouse

items.description: AI-Based SEO Analysis & Monitoring Tool
items.title: Screpy

items.description: YSlow analyzes web pages and suggests ways to improve their performance based on a set of rules for high-performance web pages.
items.title: YSlow

items.description: YSlow for PhantomJS also introduces new output formats for automated test frameworks: TAP (Test Anything Protocol) and JUnit.
items.title: YSlow for PhantomJS

items.description: Grunt plugin for continuous measurement of WebPageTest. ()
items.title: Grunt-WebPageTest

items.description: Grunt task for testing page performance using PhantomJS, a headless WebKit browser.
items.title: Grunt-yslow

items.description: A Grunt.js task for enforcing a performance budget ().
items.title: Grunt-perfbudget

items.description: Web Tracing Framework is a set of libraries, tools, and visualizers for the tracing and investigation of complex web applications

items.description: An extensible open-source load testing tool for advanced Linux users which is especially good as a part of an automated load testing suite.

items.description: Online quick and easy tool that audits frontend bad practices, reveals performance issues, and profiles JavaScript.

items.description: A web performance optimization and analysis tool.
items.title: Pagelocity

items.description: Collect performance metrics for your library/application using Chrome headless.

items.description: Speedrank monitors the performance of your site in the background. It displays Lighthouse reports over time and delivers recommendations for improvement. Speedrank is a paid product with 14-day-trial.

items.description: Webpage load time is extremely important for conversion and revenue. Visualize web performance against competitors.
items.title: Lightest App

items.description: YSlow.js on Node.js is a simple Node.js wrapper for programmatically running phantomjs yslow.js.

items.description: PageSpeed Insights for Node.js - with reporting.

items.description: Keep your bundle size in check.

items.description: Analyze and debug bundle space usage through source maps.

items.description: Helps you find the performance impact of adding an npm package to your frontend bundle.

items.description: webpack plugin and CLI utility that represents bundle content as a convenient interactive zoomable treemap.

items.description: Visualise the module tree of browserify project bundles and track down bloat.

items.description: analyze and Visualise project bundles created by Lasso.

items.description: jsPerf aims to provide an easy way to create and share test cases, comparing the performance of different JavaScript snippets by running benchmarks.
items.title: JSPerf

items.description: A robust benchmarking library that works on nearly all JavaScript platforms, supports high-resolution timers, and returns statistically significant results.
items.title: Benchmark.js

items.description: JSLitmus is a lightweight tool for creating ad-hoc JavaScript benchmark tests.
items.title: JSlitmus

items.description: Matcha allows you to design experiments that will measure the performance of your code. It is recommended that each bench focus on a specific point of impact in your application.
items.title: Matcha

items.description: Timing.js is a small set of helpers for working with the Navigation Timing API to identify where your application is spending its time. Useful as a standalone script, DevTools Snippet, or bookmarklet.

items.description: This class provides a simple info box that will help you monitor your code performance.
items.title: Stats.js

items.description: Performance tests of JavaScript inheritance models.
items.title: PerfTests

items.description: minimal monitor for JS Heap Size via performance memory.

items.description: Benchmark and profile PHP code blocks whilst measuring the performance footprint.

items.description: YSlow analyzes web pages and suggests ways to improve their performance based on a set of rules for high-performance web pages.
items.title: Yahoo YSlow for Mobile/Bookmarklet

items.description: A bookmarklet to create a frontend performance heatmap of resources loaded in the browser using the Resource Timing API.

items.description: A cross-platform, cross-browser bookmarklet that will analyze the DOM & other features of the page you're on, and give you its bill of health.

items.description: CSS Stress is a Testing and Performance Profiling.

items.description: JavaScript code generation tool that lets you write JavaScript that outputs JavaScript. Good for unrolling loops and writing libraries that compile away the runtime

items.title: Glue

items.description: Spriter is a simple and flexible dynamic sprite generator for CSS, using Python. It can process CSS both synchronous and asynchronous as it provides classes to be used in your Python code and also a watcher that listens to your filesystem and changes CSS and sprite as soon as a static is changed.
items.title: Pitomba-spriter

items.description: SVG sprites & stacks galore — Grunt plugin wrapping around svg-sprite that reads in a bunch of SVG files, optimizes them and creates SVG sprites and CSS resources in various flavors.

items.description: gulp task for creating an image sprite and the corresponding style sheets for Gulp.

items.description: Optimizes and renders SVG files in CSS / Sass sprites.

items.description: Assetgraph transform for auto-generating sprites based on the CSS dependency graph.

items.description: Sprite Cow helps you get the background-position, width, and height of sprites within a spritesheet as a nice bit of copyable CSS.

items.description: is an open-source (MIT license) project supported by Getify Solutions. The core purpose of LABjs is to be an all-purpose, on-demand JavaScript loader, capable of loading any JavaScript resource, from any location, into any page, at any time.

items.description: open source tool that helps monitor various site performance metrics over time. It captures the results of YSlow, Page Speed Insights, WebPageTest and dynaTrace Ajax Edition.

items.description: Using Phantomas (a PhantomJS-backed client performance metrics scrapper). Benchmark a page, store results in MongoDB, and display results via the built-in server.

items.description: analyze your website's speed in real browsers from 20 locations worldwide.
items.title: Dotcom-tools

items.description: Run a free site speed test from multiple locations around the globe using real browsers (IE and Chrome) and at real consumer connection speeds. You can run simple tests or perform advanced testing including multi-step transactions, video capture, content blocking and much more. Your results will provide rich diagnostic information including resource-loading waterfall charts, Page Speed optimization checks and suggestions for improvements.
items.title: WebPageTest

items.description: Sitespeed.io is an open-source tool that will check your site against web performance best practice rules and use the Navigation Timing API to collect metrics. It will create XML & HTML output of the result.

items.description: Runtime Browser Performance regression suite ().

items.description: Real Browser Monitoring. Offers complete reports about web performance and quality using YSlow, Page Speed and numerous custom tips.
items.title: DareBoost

items.description: Full featured Real User Monitoring solution. Free tier for smaller sites. Includes monitoring for Google's Core Web Vitals.
items.title: Bytes Matter Real User Monitoring

items.description: HtmlCompressor is a small, fast, and very easy to use Java library that minifies given HTML or XML source by removing extra whitespaces, comments, and other unneeded characters without breaking the content structure. As a result page become smaller in size and load faster. A command-line version of the compressor is also available.
items.title: HTMLCompressor

items.description: django-html in an HTML minifier for Python with full support for HTML 5. It supports Django, Flask and any other Python web framework. It also provides a command-line tool that can be used for static sites or deployment scripts.
items.title: Django-htmlmin

items.description: HTMLMinifier is a highly configurable, well-tested, Javascript-based HTML minifier, with lint-like capabilities.
items.title: HTMLMinifier

items.description: A grunt plugin to minify HTML that uses HTMLMinifier.
items.title: Grunt-contrib-htmlmin

items.description: A gulp plugin to minify HTML that uses HTMLMinifier.

items.description: Grunt plugin for HTML compression, using htmlcompressor.

items.description: Ruby wrapper for kangax html-minifier.
items.title: HTML_minifier

items.description: Ruby gem for compressing html, that removes all whitespace junk, and leaves only HTML.
items.title: HTML_press

items.description: Middleware that minifies your HTML responses using html-minifier. It uses html-minifier's default options which are all turned off by default, so you have to set the options otherwise it's not going to do anything.
items.title: Koa HTML Minifier

items.description: A HTML min tool by kangax (HTMLMinifier Creator).
items.title: HTML Minifier Online

items.description: Minimize is an HTML minifier based on the node-htmlparser,currently, HTML minifier is only usable server-side. Client-side minification will be added in a future release.

items.description: A simple Windows command-line tool to minify your HTML, Razor views & Web Forms views
items.title: Html-minifier

items.description: JavaScript compressor which, in addition to removing comments and white-spaces, obfuscates local variables using the smallest possible variable name. This obfuscation is safe, even when using constructs such as 'eval' or 'with' (although the compression is not optimal is those cases) Compared to jsmin, the average savings is around 20%.
items.title: YUI Compressor

items.description: UglifyJS is a JavaScript parser, minifier, compressor or beautifier toolkit, written in JavaScript.

items.description: CSS minimizer unlike others. In addition to usual minification techniques, it can perform structural optimization of CSS files, resulting in smaller file size compared to other minifiers.

A HTTP benchmarking tool (with optional Lua scripting for request generation, response
